node.title: Guantánamo Bay: Beyond the Prison
node.description: With 6,000 residents and the feel of a college campus, the U.S. Navy base has some of the trappings of small-town America, and some of a police state.

node.title: Climate Change Activists Target Amazon Warehouses in Europe on Black Friday
node.description: Extinction Rebellion is blocking entry at facilities in the UK, Germany and Netherlands to address Black Friday's "toxic consumerism."

node.title: Is Vaccine Hoarding to Blame for B.1.1.529 COVID Variant Emerging From Africa?
node.description: A special adviser to the WHO head tweeted: "How do you double down on inequity and injustice? Deny countries vaccines so they generate variants and then when they do impose travel restrictions."

node.title: Wallabies coach apologises for spray at referees after Wales loss
node.description: World Rugby issues Dave Rennie with a written warning after his comments after the Wallabies last-gasp loss to Wales in Cardiff.

node.title: More Black Summers ahead as climate change increases risk of megafires: CSIRO
node.description: Research shows climate change has increased the frequency and extent of megafires in Australia, with scientists warning the year following a La Niña is the most treacherous.

node.title: SA announces 'grand initiative' to create Australia's largest national park
node.description: The Munga-Thirri—Simpson Desert National Park in far northern South Australia becomes Australia's newest and largest national park.

node.title: The Humble Beginnings of Today’s Culinary Delicacies
node.description: Many of our most revered dishes were perfected by those in need, then co-opted by the affluent. Is that populism at play, or just the abuse of power?

node.title: In Canada, the Premier of Quebec Worries About the State of Hockey
node.description: With the Canadiens in a losing funk, François Legault has expressed concern about the declining number of Quebec-born pros and vowed to get to the bottom of it.

node.title: France-U.K. Acrimony Over Channel Crossings Deepens
node.description: The French responded angrily to Boris Johnson’s suggestion that France take back migrants who reach Britain, and rescinded an invitation for a top British official to discuss the crisis.

node.title: Amazing Video Shows Super Strong Jello Staying Intact After Being Run Over
node.description: The jello-like hydrogel substance can even survive the pressure equivalent to being stood on by an elephant, despite being 80 percent water.

node.title: U.S. Lawmakers Say Taiwan 'On the Rise' as They Ignore China Warnings to Visit Country
node.description: "The fortitude & determination of the people, led by their dynamic (frankly, kick-ass) President, is downright inspiring," Rep. Elissa Slotkin, a Democrat from Michigan said.

node.title: Dyson Black Friday Deals 2021: Save up to 25% on the Airwrap, Hair Dryers, Vacuums and More
node.description: Customers can bag a discount of up to $200 on select Dyson devices offered at Best Buy, Walmart and the Dyson website.

node.title: Boy Who Threw up at Same Time Every Day Diagnosed With Brain Cancer
node.description: "You could almost set your watch by it," said the 5-year-old's father, Phil Gidman. "At 6 a.m. every morning he'd wake up, vomit and then go about his usual day."

node.title: Here's How to Reheat Turkey Safely After Thanksgiving Day
node.description: Thanksgiving leftovers come with no fuss when it comes to serving them. But there are some factors to bear in mind to safely reheat turkey.

node.title: Cozy Season Is Here
node.description: A guide to your post-Thanksgiving weekend.

node.title: What's behind the push for a fourth stimulus check
node.description: IRS has distributed almost 170 million payments. But hardship remains widespread as the Delta variant spreads.

node.title: Woman Gunned Down in Thanksgiving Shooting Outside Walmart
node.description: The victim is in a stable condition following the shooting in a parking lot in Opelousas, Louisiana.

node.title: Substitue scores first A-League Men goal to give John Aloisi first win as Western United manager
node.description: The Victorian club snaps a nine-match losing streak in the A-League Men with their 1-0 win over Perth Glory at home.

node.title: Abigail Spanberger on Biden, FDR and what Democrats want - "The Takeout"
node.description: The Virginia congresswoman talked with host Major Garrett about losses in Virginia and how Democrats should be thinking about the midterm elections.

node.title: After Meeting With Victim, Former Missouri Officer Is Cleared of Assault
node.description: The charge was dropped after the former police officer and the woman she shot outside a supermarket in Ladue, Mo., agreed to meet with a mediator over Zoom, prosecutors said.

node.title: Europe is being tested by waves of cases that threaten its progress against the pandemic.
node.description: The deteriorating situation is also worrisome for the United States, as trends in new Covid cases tended to follow Europe by weeks.

node.title: Nu B.1.1529 COVID Variant Fears Spark Global Travel Restrictions on Southern Africa
node.description: The B.1.1.529 variant that first emerged in Botswana, has now been detected in South Africa, Hong Kong and Israel.

node.title: ‘Cuando tienes menos, eso te impulsa’: los jóvenes de los países pobres son más optimistas
node.description: Según una encuesta global, más de la mitad de los estadounidenses, jóvenes y adultos, dicen que los niños de hoy serán menos exitosos económicamente que sus padres.

node.title: In Europe, trying to find fun and games in holiday retailing.
node.description: Black Friday discounts are now routine for European toy stores and other retailers, but pandemic restrictions remain a big presence in some areas.

node.title: How Black Friday got its name.
node.description: Historians say the Philadelphia police took to calling the day before the annual Army-Navy football game Black Friday because officers had to work long hours and deal with bad traffic, bad weather and other miseries.

node.title: France excludes UK from Channel migrants crisis meeting after criticism from British Prime Minister
node.description: France tells UK Home Secretary Priti Patel she is no longer invited to a meeting over the Channel migration crisis after British Prime Minister criticised Paris's handling of the situation.
